definitions: partial floor built between two main floors of a building
lowest balcony or forward part of a theater balcony
intermediate financing layer between debt and equity in corporate finance
examples: The office mezzanine overlooked the main production floor below
They converted the mezzanine into additional storage space
Our seats were in the mezzanine section of the theater
The mezzanine offered excellent views of the stage performance
The company secured mezzanine financing for their expansion project
Mezzanine debt typically carries higher interest than senior loans

definitions: female singing voice between soprano and contralto ranges
musical term meaning medium or moderate in tempo or volume
examples: The mezzo performed the lead role in Carmen beautifully
She trained for years to develop her mezzo voice
The conductor indicated mezzo forte for that passage
Play this section mezzo piano rather than fortissimo

definitions: shortened informal term for microphone used to capture sound
examples: Pass me the mic so I can make an announcement
The singer dropped the mic after her powerful performance

definitions: shiny silicate mineral that splits into thin transparent sheets
examples: The granite contained flecks of mica that sparkled in sunlight
Mica sheets were once used as window material before glass

definitions: microscopic organism especially bacteria, viruses, or other pathogens
examples: Scientists discovered new microbes living in extreme ocean depths
Proper handwashing helps eliminate harmful microbes from spreading

definitions: scientist who specializes in studying microscopic organisms and their effects
examples: The microbiologist identified the bacterial strain causing the outbreak
She worked as a microbiologist developing new antibiotic treatments

definitions: branch of biology dealing with microscopic organisms including bacteria and viruses
examples: She earned her doctorate degree in microbiology from Stanford
Microbiology has revolutionized our understanding of infectious diseases

definitions: small brewery producing limited quantities of specialized beer
examples: The local microbrewery offers tours every Saturday afternoon
They opened a microbrewery featuring unique craft beer recipes

definitions: medical condition where baby's head is significantly smaller than normal
examples: The doctor diagnosed microcephaly during the prenatal ultrasound examination
Zika virus infection during pregnancy can cause microcephaly

definitions: tiny electronic circuit used in computers and electronic devices
small identification device implanted under pet's skin for tracking
examples: The microchip processes millions of calculations per second
Engineers designed a more efficient microchip for smartphones
The veterinarian scanned for the dog's microchip to find its owner
Getting your pet microchipped helps reunite lost animals

definitions: lowest-level instructions controlling processor operations at hardware level
examples: The processor executes microcode to perform complex CPU operations
Engineers updated the microcode to fix security vulnerabilities

definitions: small computer with microprocessor as its central processing unit
examples: The first microcomputers revolutionized personal computing in the 1970s
Schools purchased microcomputers for their computer education programs

definitions: small-scale version representing characteristics of something much larger
examples: The classroom was a microcosm of society's broader challenges
This neighborhood serves as a microcosm of urban development

definitions: photographic film containing miniaturized documents for storage and preservation
examples: Libraries store old newspapers on microfilm to save space
Researchers examined microfilm archives from the nineteenth century

definitions: precision instrument for measuring very small distances or thicknesses
unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter
examples: The machinist used a micrometer to check the part's dimensions
This micrometer can measure to thousandths of an inch
The bacteria measured only three micrometers in diameter
Hair thickness typically ranges from fifty to hundred micrometers

definitions: unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter
examples: The filter removes particles larger than five microns
Semiconductor features are measured in fractions of microns

definitions: microscopic organism including bacteria, fungi, protozoa, and viruses
examples: Beneficial microorganisms help decompose organic matter in soil
The laboratory studies pathogenic microorganisms causing human diseases

definitions: device that converts sound waves into electrical signals for recording
examples: The reporter held the microphone toward the interview subject
Adjust the microphone settings to reduce background noise

definitions: integrated circuit containing all functions of a computer's central processor
examples: The new microprocessor doubles the computer's processing speed
Intel developed the first commercial microprocessor in 1971

definitions: instrument using lenses to magnify objects too small for naked eye
examples: Students examined plant cells under the microscope during biology class
The electron microscope revealed unprecedented detail of viral structures

definitions: use of microscopes to view objects and areas invisible to naked eye
examples: Advanced microscopy techniques revolutionized cellular biology research
She specialized in fluorescence microscopy for medical diagnosis

definitions: oven using electromagnetic waves to heat food quickly
electromagnetic radiation with wavelength between infrared and radio waves
examples: Heat the leftovers in the microwave for two minutes
The microwave beeped when the popcorn finished cooking
Microwave radiation carries signals for cellular phone networks
Scientists study microwave emissions from distant galaxies

definitions: point or region in the air or sky away from ground
examples: The acrobat caught her partner in midair during the performance
Birds collided in midair while chasing the same insect

definitions: portion of brainstem connecting forebrain and hindbrain controlling vision and hearing
examples: The midbrain processes auditory and visual reflexes automatically
Damage to the midbrain affects motor control and consciousness

definitions: middle of the day around noon when sun is highest
examples: The desert temperature peaks at midday during summer months
Workers took their midday break in the shade

definitions: point or part equally distant from edges or extremes
intermediate stage between beginning and end of process or period
examples: Place the vase in the middle of the table
The arrow hit the middle of the target perfectly
We're in the middle of renovating our kitchen
The plot twist comes in the middle of the novel

definitions: person who buys from producers and sells to retailers or consumers
examples: Farmers sell directly to consumers, eliminating the middleman entirely
The middleman takes a percentage of every transaction

definitions: boxer or wrestler competing in weight class typically around 160 pounds
examples: The middleweight champion defended his title successfully last night
He moved up from welterweight to middleweight division

definitions: moderate or average in size, amount, or quality
examples: The restaurant serves middling food at premium prices
His performance was middling compared to other candidates

definitions: central area of sports field between defensive and offensive zones
examples: The team controlled midfield throughout the entire match
She plays midfield position for the national soccer team

definitions: tiny flying insect often found in swarms near water
examples: Clouds of midges hovered over the lake at sunset
The camping trip was ruined by biting midges

definitions: person of unusually small stature due to medical condition
something much smaller than usual size in its category
examples: The term midget is now considered offensive when referring to people
Medical professionals prefer the term person with dwarfism
They raced midget cars at the local speedway
The midget submarine could only hold two crew members

definitions: middle or interior part of a country away from coasts
examples: Industries developed rapidly in England's midland regions
The midland dialect differs from coastal speech patterns

definitions: imaginary line dividing something into equal left and right halves
examples: The surgeon made an incision along the abdominal midline
Symptoms appeared on both sides of the body's midline

definitions: twelve o'clock at night marking the transition between days
examples: The party continued until well after midnight
Cinderella had to leave the ball before midnight

definitions: exact middle point of a line segment or time period
examples: We reached the midpoint of our journey by noon
Calculate the midpoint between these two coordinates

definitions: central vein of a leaf from which smaller veins branch
examples: The midrib provides structural support for the entire leaf
Insects often feed along the leaf's midrib

definitions: middle region of the human torso including abdomen
central portion of any elongated object or structure
examples: Boxing strikes to the midsection can be very effective
She focused her workout on toning her midsection
The ship broke apart at the midsection during the storm
Reinforce the midsection of the bridge for added strength

definitions: officer trainee in naval academy or lowest commissioned officer rank
examples: The midshipman graduated from Annapolis Naval Academy with honors
Midshipmen spend summers training aboard active naval vessels

definitions: middle point or part surrounded by or occurring during something
examples: We found ourselves in the midst of a thunderstorm
She remained calm in the midst of chaos

definitions: middle of a stream or river current
in the middle of an activity or process
examples: The canoe capsized in midstream where currents were strongest
Rocks jutted up from midstream creating dangerous rapids
Don't change horses in midstream during critical negotiations
The project was cancelled midstream due to budget cuts

definitions: middle of summer season typically around the summer solstice
examples: The midsummer festival celebrates the longest day of the year
Gardens reach peak bloom during midsummer months

definitions: examination given in the middle of an academic term
elections held halfway through a president's term of office
examples: Students studied all night preparing for midterm exams
The professor scheduled the midterm for next Thursday
Voter turnout increased significantly during the midterm elections
The party lost seats in both midterm cycles

definitions: point or position halfway between two places or times
area at fair or carnival where games and attractions are located
examples: We stopped for lunch midway through our road trip
The town lies midway between Chicago and Detroit
Children enjoyed the rides and games along the carnival midway
Vendors sold cotton candy throughout the midway

definitions: middle of the week typically Tuesday through Thursday
examples: Hotel rates drop significantly during midweek periods
The midweek meeting was rescheduled for Thursday

definitions: trained professional who assists women during childbirth and pregnancy
examples: The midwife monitored the baby's heartbeat throughout labor
Many women choose midwife care for natural birth experiences

definitions: profession and practice of assisting women in childbirth
examples: She studied midwifery at the university's nursing program
Midwifery care emphasizes natural birthing processes

definitions: middle of winter season typically the coldest time of year
examples: Temperatures plummeted to record lows during midwinter
The midwinter celebration brightened the darkest time of year

definitions: person's appearance or manner especially indicating mood or character
examples: His serious mien suggested deep concentration on the problem
Despite her cheerful mien, she was deeply troubled

definitions: great physical strength or force of body
power or authority especially of a nation or ruler
examples: He pushed against the door with all his might
The warrior's might was legendary throughout the kingdom
The military might of superpowers shapes global politics
Economic might often translates into political influence
